intro: Chilita mazatlanensis, commonly known as the Mazatlan chilita, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
